abstract: Hilla Becher, German photographer who, along with her husband Bernd developed a signature minimalist technique, often referred to as New Objectivity, that captured the rise of industrialism and its effects across multiple landscapes, dies at age 81.
lead_paragraph: Ms. Becher and her husband, Bernd, documented coal mines, steel mills and other features of the industrial landscape, straddling the worlds of archival documentation and conceptual art.

headline.main: Hilla Becher, Photographer Who Chronicled Industrial Scenery, Dies at 81
headline.print_headline: Hilla Becher, German Photographer of Industrial Scenery, Is Dead at 81

snippet: Ms. Becher and her husband, Bernd, documented coal mines, steel mills and other features of the industrial landscape, straddling the worlds of archival documentation and conceptual art.
